summary: Catalan is a language spoken in several regions of Spain, Andorra, and parts of France and Italy. It developed from Latin during the Middle Ages. Artur Mas, a former leader of Catalonia, highlights the importance of this language in shaping individual and collective identities. Catalan has official status in various places, and its speakers often refer to their territories as the "Catalan Countries." The language has a rich history, with a literary revival in the 19th and early 20th centuries.
title: Catalan language
